edu.vt.api.eatstreet

Class EatStreetApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.vt.api.eatstreet.EatStreetApi

  • public class EatStreetApi
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the main connecting component to the EatStreet API. It provides the ability to search for restaurants and manage a user's account with EatStreet. Registering a new user: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     String newUserApiKey = api.registerUser("example@example.com",
                                             "password",
                                             "John",
                                             "Doe",
                                             "123-456-7890");
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Updating a user: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     api.updateUser("password2",
                    "John",
                    "Doe",
                    "123-456-7890");
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Get user's information: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     User apiUser = api.getUser();
 
     List<Address> savedAddress = apiUser.getSavedAddresses();
     List<CreditCard> savedCards = apiUser.getSavedCards();
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Add / Remove Address from User's Account: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     Address address = new Address();
     address.setStreetAddress("1234 Example Street");
     address.setCity("Exampleville");
     address.setState("VA");
     address.setZip("12345");
 
     api.addAddress(address);
     api.removeAddress(address);
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Add / Remove Credit Card from User's Account: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     CreditCard card = new CreditCard();
     card.setCardholderName("John Doe");
     card.setCardholderStreetAddress("1234 Example Lane, Blacksburg, VA");
     card.setCardholderZip("24060");
     card.setCardNumber("1234123412341234");
     card.setCvv("123");
 
     api.addCard(card);
     api.removeCard(card);
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Get user's order history: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     List<Order> pastOrders = api.getOrderHistory();
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }
    Search restaurants: 
    
 EatStreetApi api = new EatStreetApi("<ACCESS TOKEN>");
 
 // The user's API key doesn't need to be set to search restaurants
 // api.setUserApiKey("<USER API KEY>");
 
 try {
     // Find restaurants that do delivery within a 2 mile radius.
     // NOTICE: The address must be in the format:
     //             [Street Address], [City], [State]
     List<Restaurant> results = api.findRestaurants("1234 Example Lane, Blacksburg, VA",
                                                    OrderType.DELIVERY,
                                                    2,
                                                    null);
     
     for(Restaurant r : results) {
         // Do stuff with restaurants
     }
 }
 catch(EatStreetApiException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
 }

    • Constructor Detail

      • EatStreetApi

        public EatStreetApi(java.lang.String accessToken)
        Creates an object to access the EatStreet Public API. Using this constructor requires later setting a user's API key in order to access some functionality
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Developer token to access the API

      • EatStreetApi

        public EatStreetApi(java.lang.String accessToken,
                    java.lang.String userApiKey)
        Creates an object to access the EatStreet Public API
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Developer token to access the API
        userApiKey - A user's API key

    • Method Detail

      • getUserApiKey

        public java.lang.String getUserApiKey()
        Gets the current user's api key
        Returns:
        The user's api key

      • setUserApiKey

        public void setUserApiKey(java.lang.String apiKey)
        Sets the user's api key
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The api key

      • registerUser

        public java.lang.String registerUser(java.lang.String email,
                                     java.lang.String password,
                                     java.lang.String firstName,
                                     java.lang.String lastName,
                                     java.lang.String phone)
                              throws EatStreetApiException
        Registers a new user on the EatStreet API. The registered user's API key will be set within the method so that it can be used automatically by other methods of the API.
        Parameters:
        email - The user's email
        password - The user's password
        firstName - The user's first name
        lastName - The user's last name
        phone - The user's phone number
        Returns:
        The user's API key created by the EatStreet server
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(User user)
                   throws EatStreetApiException
        Updates a user's information on EatStreet
        Parameters:
        user - The user to update. The fields password, firstName, lastName, and phone will be checked and updated
        Returns:
        true on successful update, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String firstName,
                          java.lang.String lastName,
                          java.lang.String phone)
                   throws EatStreetApiException
        Updates a user's information on EatStreet. In order to use this method, the user's api key must have been set or passed in to this classe's constructor.
        Parameters:
        password - The new user password (may be null to keep original value)
        firstName - The new user first name (may be null to keep original value)
        lastName - The new user last name (may be null to keep original value)
        phone - The new user phone (may be null to keep original value)
        Returns:
        true on successful update, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs

      • getUser

        public User getUser()
             throws EatStreetApiException
        Gets a user's info from the EatStreet API.
        Returns:
        A User object containing the user's information
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs

      • addAddress

        public Address addAddress(Address newAddress)
                   throws EatStreetApiException
        Adds an Address to the user's account.
        Parameters:
        newAddress - The new Address to add
        Returns:
        The Address that was added or, if Address was already registered for the user, the already registered Address
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If the request is unable to be made or was corrupted

      • removeAddress

        public boolean removeAddress(Address addressToRemove)
                      throws EatStreetApiException
        Remove a user's saved Address
        Parameters:
        addressToRemove - The Address to remove
        Returns:
        true if removed successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If the request is unable to be made or was corrupted

      • addCard

                   throws EatStreetApiException
        Save a CreditCard to the user's account
        Parameters:
        cardToAdd - The card to add
        Returns:
        The CreditCard that was added, or, if CreditCard was already registered for the user, the already registered CreditCard
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If the request is unable to be made or was corrupted

        Returns:

        Throws:

                                      throws EatStreetApiException
        Get the user's order history
        Returns:
        A List of Order objects representing the order history of the user
        Throws:

      • findRestaurants

        public java.util.List<Restaurant> findRestaurants(java.lang.String streetAddress,
                                                  OrderType delivery,
                                                  int radius,
                                                  java.lang.String... extraSearchTerms)
                                           throws EatStreetApiException
        Find nearby restaurants
        Parameters:
        streetAddress - A street address including city, state, and zip (e.g. 316 W. Washington Ave., Madison, WI)
        delivery - The type of ordering done by the restaurant (e.g. pickup, delivery, or both)
        radius - The delivery radius (in miles)
        extraSearchTerms - Variable number of String arguments containing extra terms to filter restaurants by
        Returns:
        A list of restaurants matching the search criteria
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs

      • findRestaurants

        public java.util.List<Restaurant> findRestaurants(java.lang.Double latitude,
                                                  java.lang.Double longitude,
                                                  OrderType delivery,
                                                  int radius,
                                                  java.lang.String... extraSearchTerms)
                                           throws EatStreetApiException
        Find nearby restaurants
        Parameters:
        latitude - The user's latitude
        longitude - The user's longitude
        delivery - The type of ordering done by the restaurant (e.g. pickup or delivery)
        radius - The delivery radius (in miles)
        extraSearchTerms - Variable number of String arguments containing extra terms to filter restaurants by
        Returns:
        A list of restaurants matching the search criteria
        Throws:
        EatStreetApiException - If a connection or parsing error occurs
